meanings.def: an instrument made of plastic or metal used for writing with ink (= coloured liquid for writing, etc.)
examples: in pen a message written in red pen (= using a red pen)
from the pen of somebody (figurative) a new book from the pen of (= written by) Zadie Smith
His pen was poised, ready to sign his name.
I grabbed a pen and began taking notes.
The President has yet to wield his veto pen to block a bill.

meanings.def: a small piece of land surrounded by a fence in which farm animals are kept
people who write books, poems, etc. have a greater effect on history and human affairs than soldiers and wars
to write or start to write something
a small mistake in something that you write or say
examples: Sorry, it was a slip of the pen—I meant to write ‘pheasants’, not ‘peasants’.

idioms.idiom: the pen is mightier than the sword
idioms.def: people who write books, poems, etc. have a greater effect on history and human affairs than soldiers and wars
to write or start to write something
a small mistake in something that you write or say
examples: Sorry, it was a slip of the pen—I meant to write ‘pheasants’, not ‘peasants’.
He penned a letter to the local paper.

meanings.def: to shut an animal or a person in a small space
examples: At clipping time sheep need to be penned.
The whole family were penned up in one room for a month.
